title: Experimental Design Project on Microalgae Cultivation and Biogas Digestate Utilization

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge in biology and chemistry, along with basic data analysis skills
context.additional_context: Learners collect and analyze experimental data in BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environments, improving decision-making tool development through formative assessments

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the impact of microalgae cultivation environmental variables (pH, temperature, electrical conductivity, etc.) on productivity using experimental data.
The correlation between nitrogen concentration in biogas digestate and microalgal growth can be expressed through a mathematical model.
A decision support tool (DST) prototype based on real-time measurement data can be designed.

resources: Portable Water Quality Measurement Device (30 Units)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
